intro: Trigonella noeana var. aleppica, commonly known as the Aleppo trigonella, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid soils and is well adapted to dry environments. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of protein. The variety aleppica is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and morphological traits.
